"I am a software engineer working at a FinTech. I handed in my resignation after my company is venturing into crypto which I am morally against."

I applaud people voting with their feet for things they believe in. 

I vote with my business: not taking money from crypto companies

photo.alt: Crypto companies. I do not do business with companies that build on top of PoW crypto technologies (e.g. ETH, BTC). This is both because I condemn the environmental impact of this activity and pledged to not benefit, sponsor or promote PoW in any way (directly or indirectly). I also view the unregulated nature of crypto and not disclosing the risks of investing to everyday people as a major risk and one I do not promote.

content.html:
From when I talked with the software engineer quitting a FinTech venturing into crypto. My stance on crypto is the same: I don’t endorse it, don’t promote it, have refused and will keep refusing to take money from crypto companies. I did my research and it’s my own, firm stand.
